MEMORANDUM
TO: Members of the Board
FROM: Allen Miller
In accordance with the Board9s wishes, I have talked with
Maurice Mitchell of Encyclopaedia Britannic^. Films to clarify a
few points of fact in the proposed arrangement Tor EBF to under-
take the sale of NAEB albums® Let me then summarize the elements
of my conversation and of George Probst3s letter which appear to
me to he most pertinent to our reaching of a decision. Briefly,
it seems to me that our choice is that of accepting a small flow
of orders which may be expected to come in to NAEB without any
particular effort with the returns of negligible magnitude or of
attempting to secure returns that might become substantial through
really vigorous exploitation by EBF. Our gamble hinges on the
size of the market in the public schools and colleges for a product
we know to be excellent and usable*
These appear to me to be the salient points but without
regard for order of importance*
1) Exclusivity
EBF feels that a two year agreement with the right
to renew is fair. The effort of the salesman which
does not result in a sale the first year often pro-
duces an order the second year.
The principle of exclusivity is so common in business
that I feel no elaboration in its defense is needed.
In my opinion EBF would be foolish indeed to print
promotional literature, to supply 40 salesmen with
kits and sales arguments without a clearcut under-
standing that all sales, both directly and indirectly
resulting from their effort, should bring a return
to the company.
2) Stockpile Investment
At the Ames meeting I was given the impression that
NAEB would have to invest a substantial sum to assure
an adequate supply before EBF undertook its sales
effort. I no longer believe this to be true.
a) No specific inventory required—>EBF will need 40
complete sets of alBums* for use as demonstrators
which they will expect to receive at cost. Of
course, this will reduce the supply on hand but
EBF does not expect NAEB to have any stated in¬
ventory.
They would expect delivery on orders within a
month.
